result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry J Pollard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: and read in. Cash bail to be applied to costs in 15CF226.

Letters of support submitted by Atty Payal Khandhar
(for cases 15CF226 and 15CF1852)
Atty Schilling moves to withdraw.  Ct. grants request to have Atty Schilling withdraw.  Ct. wil put on trial calendar.
defn's motion to modify bond.  Argument by Atty Schilling.  Argument by DDA Moeser.

100 CASH BAIL
AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
-  Upon payment of $100 cash bond, the defendant is ordered to report to the Bail Monitoring Program (BMP).  Defendant is to report there on the day of his release, or not later than 10:00 AM on the business day immediately following his release.
-  If the defendant fails to comply with BMP, a body only bench warrant shall be issued.  
- Defendant shall not be at 1223 S Thompson Dr in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not be at any school.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant may have indirect contact  with Renee M. or Jackie N. through a third party solely for purposes of arranging for supervised contact with his daughters.
- Defendant may have supervised contact with his children, except TJP, DOB of 8-18-2001, if the mothers of his children consent to such contact.
Set for plea/sentencing hearing in approximately 90 days
to Amend Bond, Consent to Supervise and Order
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)

$100 CASH BAIL
AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
-  Upon payment of $100 cash bond, the defendant is ordered to report to the Bail Monitoring Program (BMP).  Defendant is to report there on the day of his release, or not later than 10:00 AM on the business day immediately following his release.
-  If the defendant fails to comply with BMP, a body only bench warrant shall be issued.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact with juveniles under the age of 18.
- Defendant shall not be at 1223 S Thompson Dr in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not be at any school.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect,  with Renee M. or Jackie N.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TJP, TLP, TP and MTP.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
-  Cash bail has been set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on lowered cash bond in the amount of $100 (per case).
-  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact with juveniles under the age of 18.
- Defendant shall not be at 1223 S Thompson Dr in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not be at any school.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect,  with Renee M. or Jackie N.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TJP, TLP, TP and MTP.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
